defined_class_label: anterior-posterior axis of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Axis that runs along the long axis of the animal from anterior (head) to posterior (tail). It is perpendicular to the dorsoventral axis and as such, it splits dorsal and ventral regions of the animal to either side.
image_comment: Depiction shows an asexual with the term annoated in yellow. Scale bar =500um

defined_class_label: dorsal-ventral axis of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Axis that runs along the short axis of the animal, perpendicular to the anteroposterior axis, running from the dorsal (back) side of the animal to the ventral (belly) side of the animal. This axis splits anterior and posterior regions of the animal to either side.

defined_class_label: sagittal plane of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Anatomical plane which divides the body into right and left parts. This plane passes through the midline.

Axis that runs from the oral pole and to the aboral pole of the spherical embryo (Stage 3 through early Stage 6). The oral pole is centered around the temporary embryonic pharynx; the aboral pole is located opposite the temporary embryonic pharynx.
image_comment: Depicted by is an illustration noting the oral-aboral axis in cyan double headed arrow. Note it starts at the temporary embryonic pharynx and extends to opposite.

defined_class_label: dextro-sinister axis of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Axis perpendicular to both the anteroposterior and dorsoventral axis that runs from the left side of the animal, through the medial region (center) and out to the right side.
image_comment: Depiction shows an asexual with the term annoated in yellow. Scale bar =500um

defined_class_label: medial-lateral axis of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Axis that runs from the center of the body, starting at the anteroposterior axis and out to the lateral (left, right, dorsal or ventral) surface of the animal.
image_comment: Depiction shows an asexual with the term annoated in yellow. Scale bar =500um

defined_class_label: proximal-distal axis of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Axis that starts at the distal part of an appendage, closest to the body, and runs to the proximal part of an appendage, farthest from the body.
image_comment: Depicted by shows a planarian pharynx exposed by tricaine treatment. The proximodistal axis is denoted with the double headed magenta arrow.

defined_class_label: basal surface of the epidermal compartment
defined_class_definition: The basal surface of the epidermal epithelium in direct contact with the basal lamina.
image_comment: The depicted by field is an electron micrograph of the dorsal epidermis in a transverse plane. The basal epidermis surface is noted with magenta arrows. Scale bar is 5um.

defined_class_label: apical surface of the epidermal compartment
defined_class_definition: The apical surface of the single layered epidermis that is in contact with the environment.
image_comment: Depicted by field is an electron micrograph of the dorsal epidermis in a transverse plane from an asexual adult animal. The apical epidermis surface is noted with magenta arrows. Scale bar is 5um.

defined_class_label: anterior region of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Compartment along the anteroposterior axis closer to the head rather than the tail, from the head margin to the esophagus.

defined_class_label: dorsal region of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Three dimensional compartment along the dorsoventral axis that is above the anteroposterior axis, containing the eyes.
Single cell layer of dorsal, post-mitotic, epithelial cells containing the dorsal stripe.
The median line/plane of bilateral symmetry along the anteroposterior axis on the dorsal surface of the animal.
The median line/ plane of bilateral symmetry along the anteroposterior axis on the ventral surface of the animal.

defined_class_label: posterior compartment of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Three dimensional compartment along the anteroposterior axis that is closer to the tail rather than the head, from the anterior boundary of the pharyngeal pouch to the tip of the tail.

defined_class_label: ventral compartment of the whole animal
defined_class_definition: Compartment along the dorsoventral axis that is below the anteroposterior axis.

defined_class_label: ventral region of the epidermal compartment
defined_class_definition: Single cell layer of ventral, post-mitotic, heavily ciliated epithelial cells
Region along the edge of the animal where the dorsal and ventral surfaces meet.
